00021 #ifndef __MLPACK_CORE_MATH_RANDOM_HPP
00022 #define __MLPACK_CORE_MATH_RANDOM_HPP
00023 
00024 #include <mlpack/prereqs.hpp>
00025 #include <boost/random.hpp>
00026 
00027 namespace mlpack {
00028 namespace math  {
00029 
00030 // Annoying Boost versioning issues.
00031 #include <boost/version.hpp>
00032 
00033 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 104700
00034   // Global random object.
00035   extern boost::random::mt19937 randGen;
00036   // Global uniform distribution.
00037   extern boost::random::uniform_01<> randUniformDist;
00038   // Global normal distribution.
00039   extern boost::random::normal_distribution<> randNormalDist;
00040 #else
00041   // Global random object.
00042   extern boost::mt19937 randGen;
00043 
00044   #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00045     // Global uniform distribution.
00046     extern boost::uniform_01<> randUniformDist;
00047   #else
00048     // Pre-1.39 Boost.Random did not give default template parameter values.
00049     extern boost::uniform_01<boost::mt19937, double> randUniformDist;
00050   #endif
00051 
00052   // Global normal distribution.
00053   extern boost::normal_distribution<> randNormalDist;
00054 #endif
00055 
00063 inline void RandomSeed(const size_t seed)
00064 {
00065   randGen.seed((uint32_t) seed);
00066   srand((unsigned int) seed);
00067 #if ARMA_VERSION_MAJOR > 3 || \
00068     (ARMA_VERSION_MAJOR == 3 && ARMA_VERSION_MINOR >= 930)
00069   // Armadillo >= 3.930 has its own random number generator internally that we
00070   // need to set the seed for also.
00071   arma::arma_rng::set_seed(seed);
00072 #endif
00073 }
00074 
00078 inline double Random()
00079 {
00080 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00081   return randUniformDist(randGen);
00082 #else
00083   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00084   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00085   return randUniformDist();
00086 #endif
00087 }
00088 
00092 inline double Random(const double lo, const double hi)
00093 {
00094 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00095   return lo + (hi - lo) * randUniformDist(randGen);
00096 #else
00097   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00098   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00099   return lo + (hi - lo) * randUniformDist();
00100 #endif
00101 }
00102 
00106 inline int RandInt(const int hiExclusive)
00107 {
00108 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00109   return (int) std::floor((double) hiExclusive * randUniformDist(randGen));
00110 #else
00111   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00112   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00113   return (int) std::floor((double) hiExclusive * randUniformDist());
00114 #endif
00115 }
00116 
00120 inline int RandInt(const int lo, const int hiExclusive)
00121 {
00122 #if BOOST_VERSION >= 103900
00123   return lo + (int) std::floor((double) (hiExclusive - lo)
00124                                * randUniformDist(randGen));
00125 #else
00126   // Before Boost 1.39, we did not give the random object when we wanted a
00127   // random number; that gets given at construction time.
00128   return lo + (int) std::floor((double) (hiExclusive - lo)
00129                                * randUniformDist());
00130 #endif
00131 
00132 }
00133 
00137 inline double RandNormal()
00138 {
00139   return randNormalDist(randGen);
00140 }
00141 
00149 inline double RandNormal(const double mean, const double variance)
00150 {
00151   return variance * randNormalDist(randGen) + mean;
00152 }
